verb.description: Free (someone) from a criminal charge by a verdict of not guilty.
examples: she was acquitted on all counts
the jury acquitted him of murder

verb.description: Conduct oneself or perform in a specified way.
examples: all the young women in the contest acquitted themselves well

origin: Middle English (originally in the sense pay a debt, discharge a liability): from Old French acquiter, from medieval Latin acquitare pay a debt, from ad- to + quitare set free.
